So this is the choice for them, as we all know Brinjal plays a vital role in South Indian peopleâ€™s life as curry, Bajji, Kura or gravy curry. Letâ€™s start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Brinjals - 8 - medium sized - diced
  • Onion - 1 medium sized- diced
  • Tomatoes - 2 small- diced
  • Green chillies - 5
  • Salt - 1 tsp
  • Turmeric Powder Â - 1/4 tsp
  • Coriander leaves - 1 cup - finely chopped
  • Tamarind extract - 2 Tb sp
  • Water - 160 ml
  • Coconut Oil - 1/2 Tb sp ( u can use any cooking oil)
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Urad dal - 1 tsp
  • Chana dal - 1 tsp
  • Curry leaves - 6 - chopped
Procedure:
  • In a sauce pan, add oil, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, urad dal, Chana dal and curry leaves over medium heat
  • Saute till they light brown in color, follows green chillies, onion, tomato, Brinjal, salt, turmeric powder and water
  • Combine everything and cover with lid
  • Cook for 20 minutes and give it a stir
  • Add coriander leaves and turn off heat
  • Make sure each vegetable cooked well and gently mash (donâ€™t make purÃ©e or paste, keep Chunks of Brinjal it tastes great)
  • Vankaya Bajji Kura ready, Enjoy ğŸ˜Š
